Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the extent to which Gov. Rick Scott cut the cost of prepaid college tuition by nearly $20,000. It is unclear if the reduction in cost applies to all prepaid plans or only specific ones.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks specific evidence or data to support the statement that Gov. Rick Scott cut the cost of prepaid college tuition by nearly $20,000.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the reduction in cost of prepaid college tuition is solely attributed to Gov. Rick Scott's actions, without considering other factors that may have influenced the cost reduction.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the reduction in cost of prepaid college tuition, such as changes in legislation or economic factors, that are not mentioned in the claim.
